subject: Ethics
title: Open Source vs Closed AI
description: A fast breakdown of Open Source vs Closed AI for builders.

hook.text: Meta released its AI model for free. Google keeps theirs locked. Who's right?

buildup.text: Open-source AI lets anyone inspect, modify, and deploy models. Closed AI keeps the code proprietary.

discovery.text: Open source democratizes access and enables independent safety research. Thousands of eyes spot more bugs.

twist.text: But open models can be fine-tuned for harmâ€”bioweapon instructions, disinformation, cyberattacksâ€”by anyone.

climax.text: There's no take-back button. Once a model is open, it's open forever. Every benefit and every risk.

punchline.text: Open means everyone benefits. Including the bad actors.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of open-source AI models?
options: They are always lower quality than closed models
Nobody can inspect them for safety issues
They can be fine-tuned for harmful purposes by anyone
